description: Continuing from issue #1 this series follows the story of Dracula during three diffent stories . His era of his legend, The Death Dreams -where he walks lost in time and Dracula 2199 where he is known as the last myth.
Continuing the stories from issue #2 more about the legend and stories of Count Dracula. This is an all black and white series

Another book featuring the 3 stories. One is the story of Count Dracula ( just before he's the subject of a book). Death Dreams Of Dracula where he inhabits peoples dreams and fears or time travel to an era while he is lost between living and death. The last story is Dracula 2199. Drac is resurrected and fights a war against science. Each story is 8 pages long. The art is all black and white. Count Dracula and Dracula 2199 continue each issue. Death Dreams is self contained. All stories written mainley by Rickey Shanklin.

Just like in the other ones . This book continues off the 3 stories that are continuing since issue #1 the 3 stories are Count Dracula, Death Dreams Of Dracula and Dracula 2199. Each story written by Rickey Shanklin and each story is only 8 pages each. All art is black and white.

Blood Of Dracula. All hell's breaking loose. The villagers of Bukovina storm Castle Dracula. What happens next in the next chapter of Count Dracula? In Dracula 2199 the ousted scientists and villagers are ready to take on our dear Count. What or who will the Count encounter this issue of Death Dreams Of Dracula. Each issue has 8 pages for each story and sometimes good stuff is also included. Each story written by Rickey Shanklin and all art is black and white.

Blood Of Dracula is a series of 3 stories in each issue. Count Dracula the story before Stroker wrote his book. Death Dreams Of Dracula is where The count is lost in time on his death march and finds he can inhabit peoples dreams or just make periodic visits. The last is Dracula 2199. Dracula is resureccted and finds himself in a war with scientist. Each story is in black and whit e and 8 pages long. Each story is written by Rickey Shanklin.

As always this book continues the three stories in the series. Count Dracula - right before Stroker writes his book. Death Dreams of Dracula- where the Count is loston his way todeath and can inhabit dreams and make periodic visits. The last one is Dracula 2199 where he is resurrected and finds that science is the leader of the world and he is regarded as a myth. Each issue is in black and white each story is 8pages long and all are written by Rickey Shanklin.

Once again we welcome another issue of Blood Of Dracula. All 3 stories are here again however this time Death Dreams Of Dracula is first followed by Dracula 2199 and Count Dracula ends this issue. Each story is in black and white and written by Rickey Shanklin

Once again this horror comic has 3 awesome stories to tell about our favorite vampire.Death Dreams Of Dracula where hefinds himself trapped on a plane between living and death but he can enter peoples dreams and can make periodic visits in the world. Dracula 2199 our lord of the undead is resurrected and wages war with the ruling scientists. The thrird is Count Dracula. Telling the tales before Stroker wrote his book.

Another exciting issue awaits us. In Count Dracula, Charon attacked Dracula- but the outcome was not what Burkholdt had hoped for. In Dracula 2199 from last issue Kleigh 02 and Marisa Guldernsternn theorized that mysterious energiies at Stonehenge could be useful to defeat the Count they made plans to go there. But Drac attacked and Marisa was badly wounded in battle. This issue includes as always the self contained story of Dracula either invading dreams or making brief periodic visits. Each story is told in 8 pages and in wonderfully drawn black and white. Each story written by Rickey Shanklin.

As always this issue continues the stories from last issue. In Count Dracula we are in the middle of a big fight between the Count and a mysterious traveller named Micah. In Dracula 2199 an ouster scientist named Kleigh 02 went to Stonehenge and used it's energies on weapons that might destroy Dracula. For once in Death Dreams Of Dracula we get an continuance this one Dracula appears in a Nazi concentration camp. As always each story is 8 pages long black and white art and written by Rickey Shanklin.

In this issue we get a treat. We get 2 stories of Death Dreams Of Dracula and Dracula 2199. The Death Dreams are 2 seperate stories. Each story written by Rickey Shanklin and 8 pages long and is drawn in exceptional black and whte.

This comes from the back of issue 13 for this. There is a special feature with art by Berni Wrightson. In Count Dracula - Dr. Stroehmann sets up shop in Bukovinia. Dracula 2199 Dracula travels to Iran. And a spooky cover by Dave Dorman and Lorraine Haines.

Continuing from issue 14this issue continue the story of Count Dracula (one of the 3 stories in this book ).We also get another chapter of Dracula 2199. We also get a self contained Death Dreams Of Dracula story. Hold up though. Besides these 3 as usual 8 page stories written by Rickey Shanklin and in black and white art there's more. What more does this issue have you ask? Why there is a flexidisc with music and a mask. How cool is that. So nice I ordered 2 . 1 to read and 1 to destroy.

This issue of Blood Of Dracula we get a Dracula 2199 eight page story from where we left off. We also get an 8 page Count Dracula story that also is continued. As a special treat we get some lost Frankenstein art work by Bernie Wrightson.both stories in this issue written by Rickey Shanklin.

This issue just like the las issue has the same format. We get the continuance of Count Dracula. Last issue Dracula made peace with Herr Burkholdt. Burkholdt finds infortion on the rise of deaths in the village . They are not done by Dracula but rather a German Doctor Stroehmann . He believes in and wants to reanimate his dead daughter. Stroehmann has a legion of vampires not like Dracula who has intellect. Burkholdt flees from seeing the monsters, only to report to Dracula who proceeds to kill him.

In Dracula 2199 we see Dracula getting ready with the muslims who follow him prepare for a final war with the scientists. We also get more Bernie Wrightson Frankenstein art.

Just one more issue to go in this under-rated comic series. This issue has 2 stories Dracula 2199 and Count Dracula. Both stories are 8 pages long. We also get 8 more pages of Bernie Wrightsons art and a awesome cover by Mike Vosburg. Both stories written by Rickey Shanklin.Just to re-cap. : Dracula 2199 the evil Lord is resurrected and is preparing for a final showdown with the leaders of the world scientists. In Count Dracula the Count's castle is being infiltrated by Dr. Stroehmann and his group of different vampires from around the world and his legion of zombies.

This is the last issue we get as usual and lately an 8 page Count Dracula tory and an 8 page Dracula 2199 story. We also get 8 pages of Bernie Wrightson unused Frankenstein art. Both stories written by Rickey Shanklin. There are also ads for Death Dreams Of Dracula comic series andBig Bad Blood Of Dracula 2 issue mini series. We get also an ad for Vampiric Jihad (spookey just like today) and an another ad for a 6 part Dracula mini series.

This issue features the end of both Count Dracula and Dracula 2199.

It's 1945, and Europe lies in ruins, the Nazi war machine defeated. As the United States looks east to the last remaining Axis power and the final push in a long war, a miscalculation in the Manhattan Project results in annihilation of the team of scientists developing the American atomic bomb. America's only remaining option is Operation Olympus - the invasion of Japan! But the bloody, island-hopping campaign that brings American forces to Japan's doorstep won't prepare the G.I.s for the horror they will face as women, children and the few surviving Japanese soldiers begin the grim preparation for repulsion.

This brutal, revisionist look at the second World War could only be handled by master storytellers Chuck Dixon (ROBIN, TEAM ZERO) and Butch Guice (ACTION COMICS, Daredevil). Every angle of this conflict will be touched upon, from the infantry storming the beaches to the Army Air Corps bombing the home islands of the Empire of the Rising Sun to the desperate struggle of the Japanese to save their culture from annihilation, as the true meaning of 'war is hell' is explored in full.

Before 'Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning,' there was a story about a boy! Witness the origin of one of horror's most famous figures in this special one-shot issue featuring a haunting cover by Darick Robertson (TRANSMETROPOLITAN).

Before Thomas Hewitt became the infamous killer 'Leatherface,' he was a troubled teenager attempting to fit in with others his age, but Thomas harbored a dark secret - an overwhelming lust for blood and violence that corrupted his soul.
name: About A Boy

volume.name: Texas Chainsaw Massacre: About A Boy

description: The exploits of the Hewlett Clan are legend, bordering on the mythological. While Leatherface is easily the "muscle" of the family, Junior Hewlett was the insane brain behind it all. What horror did he live through in the Korean War that could have pushed him into a complete psychotic breakdown?
name: Hoyt, By Himself

description:
Reprint of Short story in Youngblood #4 (Encore Presentation).

Upon a spacecraft reaching Space Bay one, capturers are bringing Pitt in for questioning. When opening the re-enforced holding cell, they notice the prisoner has escaped. The cell guard who failed to keep Pitt locked -up then takes his own life with his pistol.

Earth, New York City, Grandpa Brakken and Timmy are riding the Subway. The situation on the car is grim, a lot of lowlife individuals ride this time of day. Grandpa notices that a young lady is being harassed by one of the gang members. He tells Timmy to stay put. Grandpa goes to the young lady's defense to break up the ensuing violence that may occur. Before he sees it Grandpa get clobbered by one of the gang members. Timmy see's this and runs up on the gang member and smashes his hockey stick over the guys head. Pissed, the gang member pulls a knife and picks Timmy up.

A bright light envelopes the car and all cover their eyes wondering what has just happened. Out of no where a naked Pitt morphs in front of them. He turns upon them, with sharp claw nails which extract from his finger tips. They try and battle Pitt, but he is way to strong and ferocious. He is outnumbered but quickly brings the numbers down. He ends the battle and returns the hockey stick back to Timmy, while Grandpa recovers from being knocked out by the gang member. Grandpa looks around and notices all the men scattered around the floor of the car. Pitt has already escaped through the top of the subway car. Grandpa did not notice him.
name: Pitt/Lupe Story

description:
Dynamite Entertainment continues the bi-monthly series featuring the most savage tales ever told! It's positively barbaric!

This month, a whole new slate of stories, including:

* Osin - from the pages of Red Sonja -- by Lieberman and Carlos Rafael

* Volaka - the beautiful and deadly warrior with a most unique secret -- by Doug Murray and Lui Antonio

* Battle for Atlantis - the isle has fallen, but the battle rages on -- by Leah Moore, John Reppion and Pablo Marcos

All under an incredible cover by the legendary Pablo Marcos!
name: Valaka Part One / Battle for Atlantis Act II Part II: Suffer Little Children / Quatermain Part Three / Osin Part Two

description:
The main story "All Part of the Design" takes place between Project Superpowers #5 and #6 at Dynamic Boy's funeral with Dynamic Man reflecting on his past and their collective adventures in Germany during WWII.

This Wizard issue also features short previews of the following mini-series spinning off Dynamite Entertainment's Project Superpowers:

  • Black Terror #1
  • Death Defying Devil #1
  • Masquerade #1
name: All Part of the Design

description:
The Gentleman Corpse himself introduces two little-known tales from the past, as well as an all-new story in this special one-shot featuring 28 pages of beer-stained art and story from Eisner Award- and Horror Guild-nom'd writer/artist/gadfly Ben Templesmith (Welcome to Hoxford).

  • Allo Chaps
  • A Pint With Sparky
  • Last Call
name: One Of One

volume.name: Wormwood: Gentleman Corpse: Down The Pub

description: Who is the man in the flying machine? What is Clearfleet hiding? And what are the Etesians and Vector Energy so desperate to get their hands on? All questions are answered, as Blythe sets off on an adventure that will change the way she sees the world – and Zayn – forever.
name: The Engine Room

description: Retired Super Heroes are starting to be targeting by an assassin, a number of those retired super heroes are members of the StormWatch pension plan. All of the evidence to these cases points to one individual: Slaughterhouse Smith.
name: Where Are They Now

description: Deep in the Himalayas, the G-Force team must battle the Charioteers of Changu?and to make matters worse, Princess is missing in action! Will she return in time to help her desperate teammates? Can they possibly survive without her? And most importantly of all?Where did she go? All-new action brought to you by David Wohl (Witchblade) and Wilson Tortosa (Battle of the Planets)!

Frustrated with her boss, frustrated with her teammates, frustrated with her life, Princess does what any red-blooded teenager would do--she QUITS G-Force! But what will the team do without her? And what will SHE do without them? Either way, the world has just become a much more dangerous place--and the forces of SPECTRA are ready to take advantage! All-new action is brought to you by David Wohl (Witchblade) and Wilson Tortosa (Battle of the Planets)!

MANGA-STYLED ACTION IN THE G-FORCE TRADITION! With her career as a member of G-Force behind her, Princess begins to try and see what life as a normal teenager is like. But she quickly learns that she can never escape her past?not when Zoltar and his evil forces of Spectra are bent on world domination...and especially not when she learns that their latest target is former teammate, Keyop! All-new action is brought to you by David Wohl (Witchblade) and Wilson Tortosa (Battle of the Planets)!

person_credits.name: Enki Bilal
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, inker, colorist, cover

person_credits.name: Enki Bilal
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, inker, colorist, cover

person_credits.name: Enki Bilal
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, inker, colorist, cover

person_credits.name: Enki Bilal
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, inker, colorist, cover

description: The Panther has some old enemys to deal with.
name: Black & White, Part 3 - Shadrach in the Furnace
Black And White, Part 4 - Kasper Cole Buys A Clue

description:
Overview

 “BLACK & WHITE: A CRIME NOVEL” Concludes! Two Issues! What will the new Black Panther do in order to get his revenge on the people who hurt his family Ö and who will pay the price? “BLACK & WHITE” concludes as Kasper Cole’s final conflict with corrupt New York police, The White Wolf, and the 66 Bridges Gang erupts into a running battle across the streets of Brooklyn.
name: Black And White, Part 5 - Glass House Of The Last Righteous Man

description:
Overview

 “BLACK & WHITE: A CRIME NOVEL” Concludes! Two Issues! What will the new Black Panther do in order to get his revenge on the people who hurt his family Ö and who will pay the price? “BLACK & WHITE” concludes as Kasper Cole’s final conflict with corrupt New York police, The White Wolf, and the 66 Bridges Gang erupts into a running battle across the streets of Brooklyn.
name: Black And White, Part 6 - Ol' Boy Enters The Life

description: This is a two-part story featuring T'Challa, drawn by the Wolverine Art Contest Winner, Ryan Bodenheim!
name: Coming To America, Part 1

description:
Black Panther scrambles to stop the assassination of King Akaje…to no avail. Deposed of its leader, who will rule Dakenia?

How will Panther cope in America or will he never get their?
name: Coming To America, Part 2

description: Start of a new panther. With guns.
name: Ascension, Part 1

description: Part 2, can panther defeat his enemy's before they defeat him?
name: Ascension, Part 2: Mama's Got a Brand New Bag

description:
Part 3 of 4 in this great run.

What fate will The panther have?
name: Ascension, Part 3: Resurrection Man

description:
The finale is here and!

In this final issue of BLACK PANTHER, learn the ultimate fate of T'Challa and narcotics officer Kevin "Kasper" Cole. Leads into the new ongoing series, THE CREW!
name: Ascension, Part 4: The Power and the Price

description: This is the end of the beginning! As the internal struggle for Burn's body comes to a conclusion, so does the outward struggle between man and machine. Who will live? Who will die? And how will the survivors cope?

What makes a hero? Driven to save lives after her son's murder, Frankie Kemp has spent years as a non-powered vigilante. But when a virus releases super-powered potential in much of the population, 'Chance' is left to face her child's shadow-sliding killer with nothing more than her wits and experience! Bestselling author C.E. Murphy, author of Urban Shaman and The Queen's Bastard, brings an all-new superhero adventure to life in Take a Chance!
name: City Of Heroes

description: Its a final showdown in the Garden of Eden as the Devil-Slayer faces off against both demons and angels in an effort to stop Armageddon! Everything is at stake if he doesn't defeat the demon Belathauzer, the archangel Gabriel, the Bloodstone Group and the other Operation: Xenogenesis conspirators in time... in the terrifying conclusion to this much-talked-about reimagining, written by award-winning horror novelist Brian Keene (Ghost Walk, The Rising) and illustrated by Chris Samnee (DAREDEVIL: BLOOD OF THE TARANTULA)!
name: Apocalypse Now

description: Continuing the most exciting and comprehensive Marvel Handbook ever assembled! This twelve-volume guide to the Marvel Universe features more than 100 huge entries in each tome! This issue – from the Elf with a Gun to Guardians of the Galaxy! Spotlighting people (Eternity, Exodus, Falcon, Fin Fang Foom, Emma Frost, Nick Fury, Galactus, Gambit, two Ghost Riders, Gravity, Guardian), places (Genosha), teams (Excalibur, Exiles, Fantastic Four, Frightful Four, Generation X, the Great Lakes Initiative, the Hand), species (Eternals) and more!
name: Volume 4

concept_credits.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe

first_appearance_concepts.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe

volume.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z

description: First appearance of the Phantom Eagle, World War I's greatest hero.
name: The Phantom Eagle

description:
Synopsis

1st Story: "If the Fates Allow..."
As Ororo Munroe (aka the X-Men's Storm) flies from the X-Men's old home in Westchester, New York, through the hometown of deceased veteran X-Man Kitty Pryde in Chicago, Illinois, and finally arrives at the X-Men's new home in San Francisco, California, she reminisces through the good and the bad of recent times as she heads home to her family. 

She is greeted by her teammate Wolverine as the two observe the unremarkable sight of mutants and humans alike celebrating the holidays together--peacefully.  The nice moment is interrupted as perpetual jokester Bobby Drake (aka Iceman) slides past the pair and throws a snowball at Wolverine.  The two proceed to catch up on Colossus, Kitty Pryde's long-term love interest.  Wolverine remarks that he's trying his best to stay strong and positive during the holidays as are several other X-Men who have close friends missing.  As other X-Men help in the festivities, Cyclops thinks of his time-displaced son Cable (who, as chronicled in his eponymous solo title, has been jumping between future realities evading Bishop in an effort to protect the first born mutant).  During these solemn and simultaneously happy times, Dazzler sings a Christmas tune for the crowd.  As Dazzler's mutant powers activate and a glowing light shines brightly from the stage, Storm remarks that the light is an important reminder to keep faith that families will always be reunited again.

2nd Story: "Last Christmas"
In New York, a Skrull details his observations of the holiday spirit just before taking over a family man's life.  While the Skrull was far away when the Annihilation Wave hit and his friends and family lost their lives, he knows that his destiny awaits on Earth where a plan is set in motion.

As he assimilates into the human population as a bartender, he notices how during these times people are more willing to be warm and open to disclosing with one another.  He takes advantage of this when he meets a handsome young man named Patrick, whose life was finally hitting its peak with a successful career and a growing family.

The warm sentiments do not affect the Skrull and when Patrick least expects it he attacks him from behind and becomes Patrick.  Participating in his role of this secret invasion, the Skrull then knocks on the door and greets his new family for the impending holidays.

3rd Story: "Werewolf by Eve"
Jack Russell, the Werewolf by Night, is an average man by day.  His Christmas decorated home is nicely done, but by night Russel becomes an animal and destroys the family's hard work.

By Christmas morning, the family is not amused to say the least.

4th Story: "Santa Claus vs. The Illuminati"
In this out-of-continuity tale (as indicated by writer Brian Reed in the credits, "save all the letters asking where this fits in") Santa Claus needs the Illuminati's help in order to deliver all the presents to the good children by Christmas day.  The Illuminati offer their gems to give Santa Claus the Infinity Gauntlet to aid him in his journey around the globe.  While Doctor Strange maintains it would be a bad idea, he also participates in giving up his gem.

Unfortunately, Santa Claus gets a bad reaction to the Infinity Gauntlet and goes mad.  The Illuminati struggle in battling Santa, but through a superpowered snowball throw Namor is able to defeat him.

As Santa drops the Infinity Gauntlet, he remarks how his hopes for Christmas this year is now lost.  Conveniently, Iron Man offers him alcoholic iron reindeer to take him through the globe to deliver the presents.
name: If The Fates Allows / Last Christmas / Werewolf By Eve / Santa Claus vs The Illuminati

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

name: Crime Reporter
Crime Reporter

description: Enter the world of Rosa Torez, a 13-year-old girl whose normal life with her mom and baby brother is shattered when an alarming incident forces her to make a life- changing decision! Rosa's story is the focus of WILD GIRL, a new 6-issue WildStorm miniseries co- written by Leah Moore (Tom Strong, TOM STRONG'S Terrific Tales) & John Reppion with incredible art by Shawn McManus (THE SANDMAN PRESENTS: THESSALY) and J.H. Williams III (PROMETHEA)! When Rosa discovers that she can communicate with animals, her world is turned upside down. Now she must figure out whom she can really trust, as animals and humans try to dictate what her role in this newfound life should be, because a wrong decision could destroy her family!
name: Beasts of Burden

description: Rosa makes a new friend, Hylax, in whom she trusts and confides completely--and yet she still feels uneasy around him. Could it be because he keeps referring to her as the "Chosen One," or the fact that Hylax is a German Shepherd?
name: Not A Creature Was Stirring

description: As Rosa and Hylax plot to defeat the Dogman, they turn to Limmershin for help. But who is this mysterious character that wields such power and control over animals? Now, all of Rosa's hopes hinge on whether or not she can complete Limmershin's challenge!
name: Fight Or Flight

description: Rosa continues to prepare for her showdown with the evil man with the dog skins, but has all her hard work been for naught? Is she too late? And what horrible act did this man commit that pushed Rosa over the edge?
name: Metamorphosis
Urban Legends

description: Did Rosa survive her encounter with the Crocodile? And if so, will she have enough energy left to face the Dog Man and save her family? Every question is answered in the stunning conclusion of this great miniseries!
name: Good Hunting

description:
Behind prison walls, a hellish box offers freedom---at a price. Nerves unfeeling, a leper seeks new sensations with the Cenobites. The limits of pain probed by computer. At damnation's heart, a writer's perfect work requires...changes. A gallery hangs canvasses stretched skin tight and painted in red.

These are pieces eager to slip into their place in the puzzle, throwing wide the door to hell and setting loose five all new tales sprung from the dark and deadly universe of Clive Barker.

  • The Vault
  • Diver's Hands
  • Writer's Lament
  • The Threshold
  • The Pleasures of Deception
name: The Vault; Diver's Hands; Writer's Lament; The Threshold; The Pleasures of Deception

description:
The delightful wickedness of Clive Barker's Hell waits for its victims in more than mere puzzle boxes. It waits in the mystery of crystal lifeforms lightyears away. It waits in seductive whispers of evil at a Parisian artists' colony. It waits in the notes a musical genius plays on the way to madness. Inside these pages, Hell waits for you---and it can afford to be patient.

It has eternity on its side.

  • The Crystal Precipice
  • The Blood of a Poet
  • Songs of Metal & Flesh
name: The Crystal Precipice; The Blood of a Poet; Songs of Metal & Flesh

description:
Winding and wicked are the roads of Hell. Roads filled with actors trading masks of comedy and tragedy for ones of human flesh. Roads backed up with vets whose wars could never leave enough scars to please the Cenobites. Roads paved with lost travelers offering their souls for a final glimpse of the light. But there are shortcuts to Hell as well, mapped out inside these pages by the infernal imaginings of Clive Barker. They're guaranteed to get you down below in style.

Getting back is your problem.

  • Cenobite!
  • Like Flies to Wanton Boys
  • To Prepare a Face
name: Cenobite!; Like Flies to Wanton Boys; To Prepare a Face

description:
Cenobites weave unholy patterns with ropey strands of brain tissue. A tortured soul binds the pages of a young girl's diary. The smallest flicker of Hell's fire is all it takes to char a family's flesh. Sacrificing a brother's eye leads to a dark cult of suicide. They're all tasty parts of one of Clive Barker's diabolic playthings, a puzzle still in need of a few more pieces...

...why not see if you fit in?

  • Firetrap
  • Glitter and Go
  • Mazes of the Mind
  • Dear Diary
name: Firetrap; Glitter and Go; Mazes of the Mind; Dear Diary

description:
Time to deal another dead man's hand, courtesy of croupier Clive Barker and his cruel conceits. Here's how the cards fall tonight...

A pair of lovers must test their realtionship---beyond the grave. Vietnam makes a soldier and a Cenobite into two-of-a-kind. Flush with terror, a mother battles monstrosities for her son's soul. And when a gambler bets on the wrong horse, it's a straight-to-hell.

Sit in a round...you may find the stakes irresistible.

In fact, we'd bet your life on it.

  • Original Sin
  • Lingerings
  • Tunnel of Love
  • The Trainer
name: Original Sin; Lingerings; Tunnel of Love; The Trainer

description:
Damning souls can be fun and easy! Just follow these simple directions (complete recipes inside!)...

Take Clive Barker's fiendish concepts. Add a pinch of a get-rich-quick scheme built on human flesh. Marinate with an evangelist whose sermons echo the abyss. Stir in a children's show hosted by the clown prince of hell. And season with a demonic brigade of Cenobites declaring war on humanity.

Scream thoroughly and bake for all eternity.

  • I in the Pyramid
  • Demons to Some, Angels to Others
  • Under the Knife
  • Clowning Around
  • Devil's Brigade; Part One
name: Devil's Brigade: Part One; I in the Pyramid; Demons to Some, Angels to Others; Under the Knife; Clowning Around

description:
They say, "All good things to those who wait." But for those impatient souls, we offer Clive Barker's Hell...

Rush to get tickets to a tragedy directed by the Cenobite, Face. Feel your pulse quicken as a demonic pet displays unwholesome affection. Hurry to the audition where an actress loses more than herself in the part. Whisk away a world leader's ideals to find the capering face of atrocity. And join an expedition into the rank legions of the Devil's Brigade.

Well, ...what are you waiting for?

  • Homecoming
  • Devil's Brigade Part Two: Haven on Hell Street
  • Losing Herself in the Part
  • Devil's Brigade Part Three: Inside the Laager
name: Devil's Brigade Part Two: Haven on Hell Street; Part Three: Inside the Laager; Homecoming; Losing Herself in the Part

description:
In this corner, in tight blackened leather, the rank legions of hell's cenobites---the Devil's Brigade. In that corner, weighing in at over three billion, the chaotic masses collectively known as humanity.

ROUND ONE: a Priest whose hope is to become a beacon of enlightenment for the One True Faith is opposed by a cenobite who means to turn his crusade into a modern day Inquisition.

ROUND TWO: a clinically minded aids researcher desperately in need of motivation in her work finds commitment, courtesy of Hell's favorite son.

ROUND THREE: a boxer in search of the ultimate physical challenge dares hell's greatest pugilists to experiments in the sweet science with stakes greater than he ever intended.

There's the bell. Let's get ready to rumble.

  • Devil's Brigade Part Six: One True Faith
  • The Sweet Science
  • Devil's Brigade Part Seven: Commitment
name: Devil's Brigade Part Six: One True Faith; Part Seven: Commitment; The Sweet Science

description:
Enlist now in the ranks of Clive Barker's infernal army and be all that Hell can make you be...

Find that no one is safe from the draft---not even a college professor whose doctoral thesis is in the restructuring of human flesh. Take your basic training from a Devil's Brigade drill sergeant well versed in the art of mass carnage. Get your marching orders from a leader to whom the schedule is everything. And lead an attack on a community theater staging a celebration of sadism.

See your local recruiter...the Cenobites are looking for a few good bodies...

  • The Schedule
  • Devil's Brigade Part Eight: Command Performance
  • Publish or Perish
  • Devil's Brigade Part Nine: No Loss to the Community
name: Devil's Brigade Part Eight: Command Performance; Part Nine: No Loss to the Community; The Schedule; Publish or Perish

description:
Life going too well for you? Permit us to offer this prescription for an acute case of sanity...

A sex offender whose depravities give even the forces of Hell pause. Community activist turned serial killer, untold carnage insanely in the best interests of humanity. Public airwaves transmitting the unholy essence of nightmares to a captive and growing audience.

Take your soul and call for help in the morning.

  • Later
  • Devil's Brigade Part Thirteen: Breakdown in Red
  • Devil's Brigade Part Fourteen: Echoes, Dreams and Revelations
name: Devil's Brigade Part Thirteen: Breakdown in Red; Part Fourteen: Echoes, Dreams and Revelations; Later

description:
PRICED TO SELL

A small down payment and you can call this all new 3 story development yours! Includes space for tortured felines and vengeful old lady cat lovers; access to deadly games of betrayal played out against the backdrop of a search for a cure to a killer virus; room for expansion into urban centers where kill crazy Cenobites trigger inner city riots; & plenty of heating and skeletons in closets! Deal of a lifetime...or anytime after! Owner, after midnight, call 666-555-PAIN.

  • Of Love, Cats, and Curiosity
  • Devil's Brigade Part Fifteen: The Kold Red
  • Devil's Brigade Part Sixteen: The Cenobite Always Rings Twice
name: Devil's Brigade Part Fifteen: The Kold Red; Part Sixteen: The Cenobite Always Rings Twice; Of Love, Cats, and Curiosity

description:
A time of Omega and Alpha...

The last troop of a Devil's Brigade fights to see diabolic order preserved in a quest for a vaccine that will save millions...while below, an infernal court proclaims sentence on a Hell besieged by the terrible chaos tearing the abyss apart. And in the prehistoric past, a boy glimpses the secret of a dread goddess---the Death Mother---who will rise again soon to provide Leviathan with its greatest challenge ever.

  • Devil's Brigade Part Seventeen: Hell Hath No Fury
  • This, I Saw
  • Devil's Brigade Finale: Reckoning
name: Devil's Brigade Part Seventeen: Hell Hath No Fury; Finale: Reckoning; This, I Saw

description:
The age of Leviathan's absolute rule is at an end.

Prepare for the coming of the goddess, Morte Mamme, imprisoned for centuries, now freed as mankind's final salvation against the hordes of hell. She will lead the seven, as the prophecies have foretold, as her Harrowers---into the depths of hell; as warriors, rebels, anarchists and heroes.

The Harrowing begins here. May She who dances go with you.

  • Taste the Darkness
  • The Harrowing: Part One
name: The Harrowing: Part One; Taste the Darkness

description:
When Mark Twain said that "a good woman's just a woman, but a good cigar is a smoke" thing, he hadn't met these two Clive Barker firebrands...

A femme fatale so diabolical that she connives to outwit a Cenobite for his position and power, elevating the battle of the sexes to new proportions... And Morte Mamme, the death mother, leading her cult of seven into battle against the legions of stormtroopers of the abyss. It's a battle from which some will not return...

These two ladies don't just smoke...they're looking to burn.

  • Many Splendored Thing
  • The Harrowing: Part Two - Insurrection
name: The Harrowing: Part Two - Insurrection; Many Splendored Thing

description:
Contents: A trio of diabolical diatribes in the saga of a Hell born of the imagination of Clive Barker.

1 (One) out of order key to a doorway of hell, perfectly altered for use as a perfect killing machine for a deadly game of Roulette LeMarchand!

2 (Two) terrified generations, seperated by centuries, doomed by a legacy of evil and betrayal, and pitted against Cenobite Hunger on the high sea, where In These Blue Depths Lie Hell!

1,000 (One Thousand) victims of a damned lineage stretching back to the days of the Pilgrims---whose last hope for rescue is the Harrower Vera Wyshak, and an all or nothing that will change them forever.

Shake well, after opening.

  • Roulette LeMarchand
  • In These Blue Depths Lie Hell
  • Death, Where Is Thy Sting?
name: Roulette LeMarchand; In These Blue Depths Lie Hell!; Death, Where Is Thy Sting?

description:
In 1982, Davis burst onto the British comics scene, earning numerous awards for his amazing artwork. American success soon followed with his work on Batman & the Outsiders and Detective Comics, and continues on such recent titles as X-Men and Justice League: the Nail, as well as the Spider-Man movie adaptation in collaboration with Stan Lee. Today Davis is recognized as one of the premiere comic book artists in the field, not only for his stunning renditions, but for his exquisite storytelling abilities..

This book, profusely illustrated with a deluxe sketchbook and gallery of rare and previously unpublished artwork, includes a tutorial by Davis on the artists that influenced him, as well as his views on graphic storytelling. Also included are interviews with long-time collaborators Paul Neary (who provides the Foreword) and Mark Farmer (who contributes the Afterword).
name: Alan Davis

description: Modern Masters Volume 2: George Perez contains page after page of rare and unseen artwork, illustrating a comprehensive interview with Perez on his stellar career. This second volume in the new Modern Masters series delves into the artist's life, as Perez discusses his Puerto Rican upbringing, how he broke into the comics field, and the attention to detail that has made him one of comics' top talents.
name: George Pérez

description:
You don’t have to be a fan of comics to know the name Bruce Timm, the subject of Modern Masters Volume 3. As a producer, director and designer of the Emmy Award-winning Batman: The Animated Series, as well as The Superman Adventures, Batman Beyond, and currently Justice League, Timm is making an enormous impact in the field of animation, creating work that both kids and adults can equally enjoy. His impact also extends into the comic book industry—Timm’s first foray into comics was the Eisner Award-winning The Batman Adventures: Mad Love, and his soon to be released mini-series Harley and Ivy is a highly-anticipated event. Now, this third volume in the new Modern Masters series spotlights the artist’s career, with his most comprehensive interview to date, discussing his influences, how his style evolved, and what it takes to succeed in both comics and animation. It also showcases page after page of rare and unseen artwork, including a gallery of his best commissioned work, as well as behind the scenes animation concepts! Often imitated but never equalled, he blends the cartoony and the realistic in such a way that is undeniably appealing, and this book is the ultimate look at the work of a true Modern Master: Bruce Timm! 

Chapter Titles 

  • Part One: Monsters and Comics -- That Was It For Me
  • Interlude: Under the Influence
  • Part Two: From Filmation to DIC & All Points in Between
  • Part Three: Warner Bros. -- Home, Sweet Home
  • Part Four: Building A League of His Own
  • Part Five: Oh, Yeah... He Does Comics, Too
name: Bruce Timm

description:
The Modern Masters series continues its look into the lives and work of today’s top comic-book artists, this time spotlighting Kevin Nowlan! Nowlan is an artist’s artist—highly respected not only by his fans, but by his peers. Cover artist, penciler, inker, letterer, colorist—even writer—he has done it all, and done it masterfully. Kevin’s work on comic-book icons Batman and Superman ranks among the best in those characters’ rich histories! His humorous “Jack B. Quick” feature—co-created with industry legend, Alan Moore—not only allowed him to explore his Mid-Western roots, but won him an Eisner Award along the way! This volume features an in-depth interview with Nowlan, fully illustrated with rare and never-before published artwork, as well as a gallery section of sketches and finished pieces. It’s the ultimate look at a true Modern Master: Kevin Nowlan! 

Chapter Titles 

  • Part One: I'm Going To Be Drawing Pictures
  • Interlude: Under the Influence
  • Part Two: Marvel Comics and A Baptism of Fire
  • Part Three: Kevin Nowlan: One Man Art Team
  • Part Four: Is That Inker... or Finisher?
  • Part Five: Jack B. Quick and the Stories of Tomorrow
  • Part Six: The Theory Behind "Pet Theory"
name: Kevin Nowlan

description: Ask any comic book artist who the best draftsman in the business is, and you’ll come up with one answer: García-López. A master of anatomy, of composition, and of storytelling, he not only astounds his readers, but his peers as well. He is also one of the most visible artists in the industry, as his illustrations can be seen on toy packaging, in DC’s “Got Milk?” advertisements, and even on jars of peanut butter. But it’s his work on DC’s “Big Three”—Superman, Batman, and Wonder Woman—that earned José Luis García-López the title of Modern Master. Modern Masters Volume 5: José Luis García-López is composed of an extensive, career-spanning interview lavishly illustrated with rare and unpublished art, as well as a large sketchbook section.
name: José Luis García-López

description:
Arthur Adams burst onto the comic book scene with the widely acclaimed Longshot mini-series in 1985 and has remained a star in the field ever since. His unique style has earned him both the Russ Manning Award and the Eisner Award, as well as a legion of fans. From super-heroes such as the X-Men, Fantastic Four, and The Authority, to pop culture icons including Godzilla, the Creature from the Black Lagoon, and even Gumby, Adams’ range of work only adds to his appeal. But it is his energetic cartooning combined with his painstaking attention to fine detail that truly amazes his fans and peers alike. Modern Masters Volume 6: Arthur Adams features an extensive, career-spanning interview lavishly illustrated with rare and unpublished art, as well as a large sketchbook section. 

Chapter Titles 

  • Part One: Comics, Monsters, and Dinosaurs
  • Interlude: Under the Influence 
  • Part Two: A Longshot Pays Off
  • Part Three: The Fantastic Voyage
  • Part Four: Riding Solo On A Dark Horse
  • Part Five: The ABCs of Comics... With Authority
  • Part Six: Storytelling and the Creative Process
name: Arthur Adams

description: From the death of Phoenix to the rebirth of Superman, John Byrne is one of the most influential comic book artists working in the business. On the X-Men, he penciled the greatest stories in the history of the title and helped propel the X-Men to their current household-name status. His work as writer and artist of Fantastic Four returned the group to prominence within the Marvel Universe. And his reboot of the Superman mythology brought national attention to the comic book industry. Modern Masters Volume 7: John Byrne features an extensive, career-spanning interview lavishly illustrated with rare and unpublished art, as well as a large sketchbook section. Experience this look at his incredible body of work on such titles as Captain America, Alpha Flight, She-Hulk, Superman/Batman: Generations, and his creator-owned Next Men, and it’s easy to see that John Byrne deserves the title Modern Master.
name: John Byrne

description:
Out of the back pages of Detective Comics came the surprise hit of 1973, “Manhunter,” and its illustrator, Walter Simonson. The series garnered awards and accolades, and the artist quickly became a star sensation. Ten years later he cemented his name among the legends of the comic book field with his epic saga, Thor. From Fantastic Four and X-Factor, to Battlestar Galactica and Star Wars, to Conan and Elric, Simonson can handle any genre with ease, and his stylized, dynamic artwork is an influence on many of today’s top artists. This, along with a grand sense of adventure and powerful storytelling, makes Walter Simonson the subject of the next volume in the Modern Masters series! This trade paperback looks at his life and work, and features an extensive, career-spanning interview lavishly illustrated with rare and unpublished art from his files! Plus, it features an enormous sketchbook section with some of the most amazing illustrations Walter has ever produced. 

Chapter Titles 

  • Part One: Well, This Is Nice. What Else Can You Do?
  • Interlude One:  Archie Goodwin
  • Part Two: Enter Manhunter... and DC Comics
  • Interlude Two: John Workman
  • Part Three: In Space, No One Can Hear You Draw
  • Part Four: It's Nice To Be Best Known For Something
  • Part Five: "X" Marks the Spot
  • Part Six: Let's Do the Time Warp Again
  • Interlude Three: Star Slammers Gallery
  • Part Seven: Gods and Champions
  • Part Eight: Starytelling and the Creative Process
name: Walter Simonson

description:
Inspired by the writings of Isadore Klauski (the first man ever to escape from Hell), three tortured souls prepare to wage war on Leviathan's legions.

Garcia: a Priest, whose recent glimpse of Leviathan's Order was more than enough for him to shed the collar forever.

Helen: a Nun, for whom a fragile faith in God will prove little protection from Hell's willful masses.

And Lee: an atheist who is about to find religion.

Together they will embark on an impossible mission... to dismantle Hell! What they're about to find out is that dying is easy, it's the after life that's hard!
name: Razing Hell Parts I - III

description:
In a bizarre summer session in the halls of hell, school is out, but the lessons are just beginning. First period, chart a teacher's journey through the ruthless and boundless imagination's of the children in her class, and a bizarre series of reports on "what I did on my summer vacation."

School was never like this --- but horror ever was...

  • The Lesson
  • Babycakes
  • The Devil's Absolution
  • To My Son
  • Old Wives' Tale
name: The Lesson; Babycakes; The Devil's Absolution; To My Son; Old Wives' Tale

description: Featuring horrifying tales of evil in the unholiday spirit. A man's obsession to solve the puzzle locked in a nursery rhyme leads him to betrayal in "Nursery Crime." Written by Frank Lovece, with art by Mike Okamoto. Then, it's "Child's Play" for a toy manufacturer to mass market the puzzles that will open the gates of Hell. Written by Sholly Fisch, with art by Steve Buccellato. Plus, two more tales.
name: Dark Holiday Special

volume.name: Clive Barker's Hellraiser: Dark Holiday Special

description:
The people of Earth are hungry and food is in short supply. Triter, the Prime Minister of Earth, wants to turn the people against Captain Harlock and tries to blame him for destroying the ship Danata, along with its food supplies. Tadashi, a boy from earth, (whose father fought alongside Captain Halrock) gets into fisticuffs defending Harlocks name. On his way back home, Tadashi meets La Mimi for the first time, (a member of the Captains Crew) and receives a note from the Captain and some food coupons. After the Illumidas find out about the activities of Tadashi, they kill his father. Harlock has to intervene and protect Tadashi by bringing him aboard the Arcadia.

At the Illumidas Hall Of Justice, Triter, holds a trial for Tochiro, (another member of Harlocks crew) on charges of treason as a ruse to get the Captain to show up. Captain Harlock does appear, however not in his ship the Arcadia, but in the Danata. The Captain spreads the message of freedom and drops food crates to the people of Earth, along with rescuing Tochiro. Watching all of this unfold, Supreme Commander Muda swears Harlock will not leave the earth alive.
name: An Exchange of Futures

description: Milos, an old Teacher of Harlock, finds the Captain at an old tree from his past. They talk and reminisce about his lost love Maya and his rival Darghund. Darghund and Captain Ferndon are informed by Supreme Commander Muda that they must find Harlock within two days. Also, Muda orders Illumida officer Shadan to have Commander Jigor monitor for the Arcadia and contact Commander Kevele when they have done so. Ferndon hunts down Milos at his home and request Milos to return with him to see Darghund, but he refuses. They're about to start fighting each other when all of the sudden the Arcadia emerges from the ocean and Shadan Orders Jigor to start transmitting its location.
name: And Its Roots Grow Strong Under The Ground

description:
The Waterfront Warrior is the city's newest hero…but the Huntress wants to know if this simple-minded but well-meaning hero can be counted on to do the right thing.

Waterfront Warrior and Huntress battle a riot between two gangs made to look like a race riot. This spoils the plans of the Brick Wall who wants to lower the property value of the area and buy it cheap. After the battle Huntress sees her psychologist. She is jealous and embarrassed by the Waterfront Warrior.

Meanwhile the Waterfront Warrior does what he can to improve hi neighborhood. Not just by fighting crime but getting people to help each other. He does all of this because of what happened to his mother. She died in a building with no heat because of a slumlord. His good deeds do not go unpunished as The Mafia sends its men in to cause more trouble.
name: Out There In TV Land

description: We see Harlock and the Arcadia appear. Harlock Jumps into the fight to save Milos from Ferndon. Commander Kevele bombards the Arcadia from orbit. Milos, Tadashi, and Harlock run off and hide at Milos House. Aboard the Arcadia, Tochiro and La Mimi Restore shields and try to hide the ship in the Mediterranean. Darghund is standing at the old tree near Milos house, and thats when Harlock and Darghund face off.
name: ...So Will The Hearts and Minds of Those Around Them Grow!

description: The crew of the Acadia can't withstand another bombardment from Commander Kevele. They scramble to get the ships warp engines in working condition and try to leave for earths orbit. At least before Supreme Commander Muda can locate their position.
name: The Color of a Rose

description:
It's the Huntress versus the mob and the corruption of volatile TV host Mike Cobb. And, in the aftermath, Helena is forced to adopt a new identity.

The Huntress and Waterfront Warrior save some squatters from a group of thugs. It is during this time that Huntress figures out who the Waterfront Warrior is. After the battle Helena sees her psychologist again and talks about how to deal with the Waterfront Warrior.

Meanwhile the Waterfront Warrior is being grilled on the Mike Cobb Show. What he doesn't know is he is being set up by the Brick Wall and the mob who have Mike Cobb in their pocket. They even planted drugs on a mother, Isabel Torres that he had helped making her look worse than she did. They also set the building the squatters were in on fire while he was on television to make him look bad.

The Waterfront Warrior goes to help the people but Huntress gets there first and saves the few who couldn't get out of the building and then she punishes the arsonists. Later she sets up Brick Wall to admit to his crimes and gives the proof to a detective fried she trusts.

The Waterfront Warrior is broken and goes back home. He look at a photo of his mother and reflects on what he did and why he wanted to help others and all the events of the past few days till he hears a knock on the door. When he opens it he finds a note to him from the Huntress. She tells his how much of a hero he really is.
name: Welcome To The Wrecking Ball

description: After their escape from earth, Captain Harlock and the Arcadia arrive at the asteroid base "SSX" for much needed repairs. Commander Muda changes his tactics on how to kill Harlock. He hires mercenaries and increases the reward payment for the death of the Captain, and Queen Emeraldas. Emeraldas arrives at SSX, she meets with Tochiro and promises to bring back equipment needed for repair on the Arcadia. On the queens departure from the base, she runs into a more advanced ship than her own. This ship goes by the name, Dark Victory, on board is man called, Torian, with intentions unknown.
name: Storms
Sins of the Father Part One
